intro: Marila ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf marila, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its ovate-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
